content:
Hi Thomas, Thanks for the interesting topic. There are 2 ways to do that.

1) Download the source from the repo, add the menus you want to add with the corresponding functionality and then use it. Feel the power of the FOSS software: https://developer.thunderbird.net/

2) If you want to propose a new feature for the Thunderbird team, here is a good start: https://connect.mozilla.org/t5/ideas/idb-p/ideas/label-name/thunderbird

Have a great day!

content:
Ma il problema lo avevo capito. E ti ho gi√† risposto: Thunderbird supporta i metodi standard per la notifica di ricezione e di lettura, ma se il server (ricezione) o il destinatario (lettura) non supportano questi protocolli non c'√® modo di forzare la cosa.

Se altri programmi hanno trovato uno stratagemma per fornire questo servizio, buon per loro. Io credo che siano comunque soluzioni lesive della privacy.

Peraltro ti faccio notare che una mail normale non ha valore di prova.

content: Did you update to v144.0 (release channel- yesterday or today? This version contains a new bug: all special (system) folders except for Inbox have English names (image).
creator: Mapenzi

content: Yes, I did. My folder pane looks like yours. Is there a way I can go back to the earlier version?
creator: B.O.

content:
In your actual Thunderbird installation first go to Settings > General > Updates and disable automatic updates. Then go to Help > Troubleshooting Information > Profile Folder > Open folder, then quit Thunderbird. In the profile folder look for the file compatibility.ini and delete it.

Uninstall v144.0, download the Danish v143.0 from https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/143.0/ and install it. Start TB, your folder names should be in Danish again.
creator: Mapenzi

content: I did exactly as you described, and it worked brilliantly! My folder names are now in Danish again. You have been very helpful in solving my problems, and I am very grateful. I would not have found out myself. Thanks so much, Mapenzi!

creator: Mapenzi

content:
At this point, I have no idea. I followed instructions from an AI at SiteGround, but they apparently weren't clear enough.

To restore local folders in Thunderbird, you can follow these steps: ‚Ä¢ Locate the Backup: Ensure you have a backup of your Thunderbird profile, which contains your local folders. This is usually stored in a directory like C:\Users\[YourUsername]\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\[ProfileName]. ‚Ä¢ Close Thunderbird: Make sure Thunderbird is not running. ‚Ä¢ Navigate to the Profile Folder: Go to the directory where your Thunderbird profile is stored. ‚Ä¢ Copy the Backup: Copy the contents of your backup profile folder into the current profile folder, replacing any existing files. ‚Ä¢ Restart Thunderbird: Open Thunderbird, and your local folders should be restored.

b) If it's the folder "Local Folders" which contains the subfolders and files present in your image from 10:35 AM, copy it to your Desktop Go back in Mail , rename Local Folders in Local Folders-old and drag it on your Desktop

We have no idea what your problem is or when it started becuiase you routinely isnore question and later post another meaningless complaint that you can see you8r folders. Like we can't fix it for you. This is a peer support forum so we cant ask questions, offer suggestion and modify our views based on relevant information provided by you.

Really I think the summary here is some time around October or November last year you received an XPCOM error and you reinstalled Thunderbird and in the process lost your folders (or something) because you have never actually said what precipitated the issue or when it started. Lots of duplicate topics which I can paraphrase as "I have lost my folder how do I get them back" is not going to cut it as constructive information that someone might be able to help you with.

So can you take the time to actually say what happened and when, with what mail provider and if the mail account with that provider was configured as POP or IMAP. I am guessing from your Firefox questions that the account is with Yahoo. That is new information in it self but for some reason you posted it about your browser not about you mail issues.

Note that I strongly suggest you continue to discuss and respond in this topic because it is my express intention to siumply delete any further duplicate you post you have been told more than once that multiple posts on the same topic are not acceptable. You appear to have ignored that advice. I intend to enforce it. I will not be locking topics, I will just delete them.

The link to this topic is again https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1541323 and the link to your posting history on this site is https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/user/drpapp/questions so there is no reason to post a new topic to reply to someones question.

content:
One more question - I am trying to add back an old email account to my current Thunderbird account. I use Comcast as my provider. All of the directions I get on line and on YouTube don't match my Thunderbird account. They say: 

Click the hamburger menu (three horizontal lines) in the top-right corner and select Account Settings, or find the settings icon in the bottom-left and click Account Settings.

Alternatively, right-click an existing account and select Settings. Initiate the new account setup: 

In the Account Settings window, find Account Actions at the bottom of the left-hand pane and click it.

And then it says ---"Select Add Mail Account from the dropdown menu." I have no Add Mail Account to select. What I get is (see iMAGE 1 attached) ....there is a blue box upper left that says "+ New Account" ...is this what I shoud click if no "Add Mail Account" button? If I do click it I get iMAGE 2 attached. My concern is on iMAGE 2 it says "Set Up Your Existing Email Address" ....I don't want to mess up my main email account ....I am confused --- will this if filled out set up my old second account and not mess up my main current account? Hope this is understandable !! Thanks
creator: rdherman

content: First, click to settings>general and verify that the box for account hub is UNTICKED. see attached. Then, click the hamburger menu, new account, email, and set it up. The menu that you couldn't find is no longer there. Some documentation is out of date.
creator: davidsk

creator: Mozilla-assistent

content:
Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer, started once and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

content: Puzzling. The error message sounds like the two PCs are the reverse of what you posted. Somewhere, there is a step being done that causes this problem. Let's start over. - Delete the appata\Local\THunderbird folder on new PC = Delete the appdata\roaming\thunderbird folder - download and install a current version from thunderbird.net - start thunderbird once and exit 0this creates the dummy appdata\roaming\thunderbird folder - NOW, repeat the steps I posted. (DO NOT copy the appdata\LOCAL\Thunderbird folder)
creator: davidsk

content:
Solved! Instead of downloading from the repository using dnf (sudo dnf install thunderbird) which downloaded and installed version 140.03, I went directly to the Thunderbird website where I downloaded v144.0. This took care of the problem after de-installing all traces of the offending software.

I might also note that, originally, I download the flatpack for v140.03. I'm assuming that the repositories aren't updated very regularly.

content:
The number of unread can be hidden from the Folder Pane with css:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1426787#answer-1609463

The total count is an option in the Folder Pane Header menu.

The number of messages in a folder is shown in the Message List Header (under View/Layout).
